intro: Melicope richii, commonly known as the Hawaiian melicope, is a member of the Rutaceae family and is native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, typically reaching heights of up to 10 meters. The plant has simple, opposite, and usually elliptical leaves with a leathery texture. Its flowers are small and clustered, with four petals, and it produces small, round fruits that contain one or two seeds. Melicope richii is often found in moist, shaded habitats, such as rainforests, and is considered a rare and endangered species.
